title: Charlie Kirk killing: Tyler Robinson's trans partner allegedly flees Utah home
description: Lance Twiggs, the transgender partner of Tyler Robinson, has disappeared from their Utah home following the alleged murder of Charlie Kirk. Twiggs, who was cooperating with investigators and received threats, was last known to be in a safe location. The disappearance adds another layer of mystery to the case, leaving the community in shock and with unanswered questions.

title: Google to engineers: AI is everywhere; skills must go beyond coding
description: Google's Ryan J. Salva emphasizes AI's central role in software development, with adoption surging to 90% among professionals. Developers are dedicating approximately two hours daily to AI tools, shifting their focus from raw coding to product design and problem-solving. While coding proficiency remains crucial, AI lowers barriers, enabling broader participation in software building and deployment.

title: Record cargoes: Russia’s crude exports climb to 16-month highs
description: Russian crude oil exports have surged to a 16-month high, reaching 3.62 million barrels daily, even as Ukrainian drone attacks cripple domestic refineries. This increase is partly fueled by OPEC+ agreements allowing higher production and the redirection of crude to export terminals due to refinery disruptions.

Dart, drafted in 2025 after a successful college career, will make his debut against the Los Angeles Chargers. His journey from Utah, shaped by his parents' guidance, has prepared him for this pivotal moment.

description: Delhi Police have registered a case against Chinmayanad Saraswati, manager of a Vasant Kunj engineering institution, for allegedly molesting around 15 female students. title: Who stopped Trump & Melania’s escalator abruptly? UN clarifies; WH smells suspicion
description: The mystery of the UN General Assembly escalator malfunction during President Trump's visit has been solved. While Trump joked about the incident, the White House initiated an investigation, demanding accountability if intentional interference was found.

title: Is Sanju Samson the weakest link in India’s middle order?

Brain-eating amoeba in Kerala: Cases spark concern; experts debate rise vs detection
description: Kerala is facing a rise in brain-eating amoeba infections, but increased detection efforts, including CSF analysis, explain the surge in reported cases. While the condition has a high mortality rate globally, early diagnosis and treatment in Kerala are improving outcomes. Prevention focuses on avoiding nasal exposure to contaminated water sources, as amoebae are widespread and difficult to eliminate entirely.

title: Science quiz: Applications of lasers
2 key Maoists gunned down in Chhattisgarh were involved in 129 killings, police say

description: Here is a select list of stories to start the day.

title: Super Typhoon Ragasa: At least 14 dead after Taiwan barrier lake bursts
description: Super Typhoon Ragasa triggered the bursting of a barrier lake in Taiwan's Hualien County, resulting in at least 14 fatalities and 18 injuries. Rescue teams are actively searching for approximately 30 missing individuals after the floodwaters washed away a bridge and inundated a nearby town. Over 7,600 people were evacuated across Taiwan due to the typhoon's impact.

title: High Court judge questioned trial court counterpart in Madhya Pradesh, his colleagues call remarks ‘uncalled for’

description: The most affected districts in Maharashtra are Dharashiv, Beed, Solapur, and Ahilyanagar

title: Local TV stations refuse to air Jimmy Kimmel’s late night show after ABC lifts suspension
Rise of Rishad Hossain - From 'spinner hunt' to Bangladesh's trump card
description: Bangladesh’s 2017 “spinner hunt” uncovered a teenage Rishad Hossain, who has since evolved into the country’s brightest wrist-spin prospect. Once ordinary, his discipline and learning curve turned him into a key T20 bowler.

title: 'Hope we can fix': US secretary Rubio on India tariffs after Jaishankar meet
description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio hinted at a potential reconsideration of tariffs imposed on India for Russian oil purchases, following discussions with S Jaishankar. Rubio emphasized the need for stronger European sanctions against Russia.

title: Here’s what happens to the body when you start your day with haldi water
A young elephant and 3 states: Why Goa is dialling Karnataka for help
Ryan Routh convicted: Trump assassination plotter tries to stab himself in court
description: Ryan Routh was convicted for plotting to assassinate Donald Trump and then attempted to stab himself in the neck with a pen in court. The incident occurred after the jury's verdict, prompting intervention by US Marshals. Routh faces a life sentence, while his daughter was removed from the courtroom after protesting the proceedings.

title: Lessons from the history of rebellions in AIADMK and DMK
description: With discomfort in the AIADMK showing no signs of subsiding, after former School Education Minister and veteran leader K.A. Sengottaiyan was divested of party posts following his call for the return of estranged leaders, it is a timely moment to revisit some of the most significant uprisings within Tamil Nadu’s two major Dravidian parties

title: Entanglement breakthrough brings quantum computers closer
description: In new research published in Science, scientists have demonstrated quantum entanglement between two atomic nuclei separated by about 20 nm

title: Asia Cup: Pak beat SL to keep India vs Pakistan final hopes alive- Scenarios explained
description: Pakistan's crucial win against Sri Lanka keeps the Asia Cup 2025 final berth hopes alive, setting the stage for a potential India vs Pakistan showdown. With India leading the Super Fours, a win against Bangladesh secures their spot and turns Pakistan vs Bangladesh into a virtual semi-final. However, a Bangladesh upset would keep all four teams in contention.

description: The typhoon sparked panic buying this week, with people piling into supermarkets, leaving little on the shelves and in some cases queuing for hours to purchase goods amid fears that shops could be closed for two days.

title: 'It's all too much': Travis Kelce faces pressure over Taylor Swift engagement & tough NFL season
description: Travis Kelce faces intense scrutiny. His engagement to Taylor Swift amplifies media attention. Kelce juggles football, endorsements, and acting aspirations. Sources say he feels pressure. There is fear he might buckle. His demeanor shows strain during games. Media constantly hounds him about his relationship. Kelce's fame impacts his interactions. People closely watch if he handles the pressure.

title: ‘Most of her time went into taking care of husband & son’: Neighbours after woman’s decomposed body found at Jamia Nagar home

description: The first tip-off came from an alert auto driver in Tiruchi who led the police to unravel a gang involved in abduction and illegal adoption of babies

title: IPR Gandhinagar team proposes roadmap for India’s fusion power plans
description: Controlled fusion can only happen in extreme conditions, the kinds that exist inside stars. There are currently two popular ways to achieve this: inertial confinement and magnetic confinement. India is already invested in the magnetic confinement technique as a member of the ITER project, which is building a reactor in France

title: Proposal to build subway at Pattabiram station sent to Railway Board
description: A proposal has been sent to the Railway Board for construction of a subway under the Umbrella Work scheme, a senior official of Chennai division of Southern Railway said; it is also taking steps to provide seating arrangements on all platforms at the Thiruninravur station under prescribed norms

description: Citizens, organisations allege denial of participation in process; formal complaint filed with Election Commission demanding open and transparent hearing.

title: NBA trade rumours: Celtics eye $24.3m Jazz duo; Simons emerges as key asset
description: The Boston Celtics are reportedly considering a significant roster shakeup to address their center position woes. With Al Horford's expected departure and Kristaps Porziņģis' exit, the Celtics are eyeing a trade with the Utah Jazz. The proposed deal would send guard Anfernee Simons to Utah in exchange for Walker Kessler and Jusuf Nurkić, bolstering Boston's rim protection and interior defense.

During a White House press event, Trump suggested a connection between medicine and rising autism rates, a claim Kennedy supported. Navratilova swiftly condemned their statements on social media, highlighting the lack of scientific evidence.

Supertech alone secured over Rs 5,157 crore from banks and financial institutions since 1998.

title: ‘We need the brightest minds’: Nvidia, OpenAI CEO defend H‑1B fee; warns US
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman have both expressed concerns over the recent H-1B visa fee hike, emphasizing the importance of attracting global talent to the U.S. Huang highlighted immigration as the foundation of the American Dream, while Altman focused on streamlining the process to secure the smartest individuals.
